page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF NASH AREA
page.content: The landscape of this part of North Bucks is one of gently rolling countryside with an open appearance of fields with sparse hedgerows and trees. From Nash in the south, situated on a low east_west range of hills (400ft), the land descends the hillface and forms a broad shallow valley leading north to Beachampton (at 200ft). All drainage in the area flows north down this valley, through Beachampton to the R. Ouse (off area). Land use is mixed-arable with some permanent pasture. The soil is mainly stiff clay, with gravel in the south, giving rise to numerous springs. The climate is typical of central south England; rainfall 65cm/yr, winds mainly S_SW, winter - mild; summer warm and thundery.
